The {@condition poisoned} creature suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion} every hour, and it regains only half the normal number of hit points from spending Hit Dice and it can’t regain hit points under any normal circumstances, including magical healing. At the end of each hour, an infected creature must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage and its hit points are reduced by the amount of poison damage taken.
The poison can only be removed by the lesser restoration spell or similar magic.

As unfortunate as it may be, the cobra just happens to be one of the more famous venomous snakes, and while its venom is certainly potent, it comes nowhere near being as fatal as that of the inland taipan. This ferocious serpent's name means "fierce snake," although not for its nature, as it's extremely shy and prefers to flee when provoked. The name instead refers to its extremely potent venom, which it delivers copious amounts of when threatened. While this reptile resides in arid, desert-like badlands, unfortunate travelers may accidentally encounter it and provoke its toxic bite. Being so far from civilization and any method of effective treatment, many who are bitten perish due to the toxin and the blistering heat. For this reason, there has been a recent influx of druids inhabiting arid regions in order to treat those bitten by the taipan

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Avatar of Kama'hu's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}). The Avatar can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.
footerEntries: When casting spells in this manner, the Avatar of Kama'hu can only target itself. {@spell Shapechange} and {@spell Alter Self} don't require concentration and are always active.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The Avatar of Kama'hu can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Formless
entries: The Avatar of Kama'hu can move through any space without squeezing.

trait.name: Spiritual Nature
entries: The Avatar of Kama'hu doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The Avatar of Kama'hu sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 16 feet.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) force damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the Avatar of Kama'hu can't bite another target

reaction.name: Absorb Elements
entries: As a reaction to being hit by acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, the Avatar of Kama'hu can capture a fraction of the incoming energy, nullifying its effect and storing its power for later use. The Avatar of Kama'hu has immunity to the triggering damage type until the start of its next turn. Additionally, the first time the Avatar of Kama'hu hits with a melee attack on its next turn, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the triggering type, and the energy is released.
{@i Slay. Survive. Reclaim.}
{@b Slay. Survive. Reclaim.}
{@b SLAY? SURVIVE? RECLAIM?}

{@i I can’t stop repeating these three words in my mind, testing them, rearranging them, trying desperately to find a meaning. What do these words mean? What am I meant to slay? Vecna, perhaps? It’s likely, given the ‘nature’ of my divine vision. But I fear I’m failing him. Kama’hu, I mean. Last night’s vision was worrying, and I must return to the village at once. What if something awful has happened? Whilst within Kama’hu’s realm, he sounded terrified and weak, as if he was struggling against an overwhelming foe. The moon, his eye, it was not his own. It was that wretched green slit beaming down at me, enveloping me in an eerie light. I wanted to run, I wanted to hide, but I couldn’t move. There was something so bone-chillingly captivating about that damned eye, and I can’t place my claw upon it. As I stared into it, falling deeper and deeper into its malevolent gaze, the earth gave way, sending me plummeting into the darkness below. As I peered down, a colossal reptilian maw opened wide before me, exhaling a noxious green smo- By the gods, that’s it! The maw belonged to that monstrous dragon that bested me at the greedy satyr’s estate, I just know it! I should have recognized the sickening smell of rot and death, but I was enveloped by the toothed jaws before I could properly register what was unfolding. As I fell deeper and deeper into the massive beast’s maw, Kama’hu’s voice echoed within my head, relaying to me those cryptic words;} {@b ‘Slay. Survive. Reclaim.’}

{@i Now that I truly have a moment to think about it, I suppose I know what I must do. I knew I would have to face that wretched monster and his winged snake one day, but I was hoping it wouldn’t be so soon. But, perhaps, this time it will be different. I have something that money and power can’t buy, something that has felled every foe that dared stand against me; I have friends. No, family. I have family that will stand beside me no matter where I go or whatever I choose to hunt. Alone, I was weak. Together, we are strong.}

{@i Perhaps, though, the situation is more dire than I had hoped. Something is wrong. Earlier, just moments after I awoke, I wandered outside. Recently, Julia has undergone a change of sorts, and I am beyond worried for her. I know it may have been wrong of me to leave her alone for the time being, but I needed to feel the warm, tropical winds of the ocean, smell the salt of the sea, and let my scales soak in the pale, refreshing moonlight. As I sat, staring and pondering, something peculiar occurred. Without warning, my right claw began to emit dancing wisps of light that flickered up my arm, as if I had begun the process of wild shaping accidentally. Curious and concerned, I watched, waiting for the familiar feeling of my form shifting into something greater. However, instead of changing, my arm began to slowly disintegrate, unraveling into flowing, weaving shimmers of blue-green radiance. Alarmed, I leapt back, but the process continued. The wisps of light began dancing and flickering around me, creating a display similar to the Sky Lights of the North and South; similar to Kama’hu’s incorporeal form.}

{@i Concerned, but reassured, I stood, watching as the lights swam and swayed around me. However, when it began to near my neck and head, I lost my nerve, clawing at the effect with my remaining hand. As my claws made contact with the phenomena, they, too, began to unravel, causing me to panic. I desperately tried willing it to regress, as if it were like the rest of my abilities. Summoning all of my willpower, I began to concentrate on ending it like I would end a beast shape. This, however, simply made matters far worse. As I began focusing on the shapes of beasts I had once seen, I began to sporadically warp and change, transforming into various creatures at random. Dragons, wolves, yetis, a monstrous snake-like beast, every aspect of my body began to shift erratically, transmuting me into something horrendous and unnatural. Bones jutted out at irregular angles, jaws formed and screamed in places they did not belong, entire organisms began to sprout from my flesh, clawing for escape before being forcefully pulled back into my body. I was terrified, I wasn’t sure of what to do. The agony of it all was unbearable. I was wracked with pain, too much to move or scream, leaving me to stand and struggle. I was not ready to die, but I feared that I had no choice, consumed by the very creatures I reigned over.}

{@i Suddenly, I was alone again, years ago, the sole survivor of my party. I was face-to-face with one of the largest reptiles I had ever seen, and I was prepared to fight to the death. The crocodile, however, gazed at me, its sharp, predatory eyes flashing a brilliant orange. Before me, it warped and changed, dissolving just like I had, transforming into Kama’hu, Lord of Primal Fury. That night was the most important in my life. It had changed me for the greater, gifting me with a purpose other than survival. Kama’hu bestowed upon me two gifts that day; the power to command the wilds and the power to feel as others could. As I revisited the events of that night, it occurred to me that perhaps this is what Kama’hu was telling me, that I had to calm myself and think like I had that night when I had confronted him. I did so, and almost immediately, the screams ceased. Gradually, my flesh began to piece back together, the churning lights slowing and reforming into my body. The rapid transmutation began to end, the howling forms of the wilds returning to dormancy as I slowly originated to my standard shape. As the last of the lights finally faded, I let out a hiss of relief. I had managed to survive the greatest horror of my short life. Calmly, I walked back into the estate, giving one last nod of thanks to the moon, sea, and sky before turning to leave.}

{@i When I returned, Julia had stolen most of the Rat Pack. They laid atop her, cuddling against one another to provide warmth. Dirk, too, laid next to Julia, snoring quietly. A sense of satisfaction washed over me as I gazed upon them. ‘This is what is truly important,’ I had thought. As I finish writing this, thin wisps of light periodically trail up and down my scales, but I am content with it. I know now how to command and control it, and I will not fail Kama’hu with the newfound blessing he gifted me with. While I’m not entirely certain why I was chosen over anyone else, I will hold my objections until dawn. For now, this is Kizar, King of Beasts, signing off.}
- Kizar’s Diary, Page 112

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The Maw of the Great Hyena has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the Maw of the Great Hyena's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The Maw of the Great Hyena has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Maw of the Great Hyena makes two bite attacks. If both attacks hit the target and the target is a creature, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition frightened} it takes an additional 22 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage. This attack ignores damage resistance.

action.name: Call the Clan (Recharges on a Long Rest)
entries: The Maw of the Great Hyena magically duplicates itself, creating up to five spiritual replicas at a point it can see within 60 feet of itself. Each replica uses the statistics of a giant hyena, except it also has the Maw of the Great Hyena's bite, multiattack, pack tactics, damage resistances and immunities, condition immunities, and cackling cacophony. The Maw of the Great Hyena can communicate telepathically with a replica as long as they are within 120 feet of each other. The replicas act as allies of the Great Hyena and obey its telepathic commands. The replicas remain until killed or dismissed by the Great Hyena as a bonus action. Slain or dismissed replicas vaporize into warming orange wisps of flame.

action.name: Cackling Cacophony {@recharge 5}
entries: The Maw of the Great Hyena emits a maddening cackle of blazing air in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, each creature in that area that isn't {@condition deafened} must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the Great Hyena until the end of the hyena's next turn. While a creature is {@condition frightened} in this way, its speed is halved, and it is {@condition incapacitated}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kraken's innate spellcasting ability is Constitution (spell save {@dc 18}). It can innately cast the following spells:

trait.name: Jet
entries: While underwater, the kraken can take the dash action to jet backward at a speed of 140 feet. It must move in a straight line while using this ability.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The kraken can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kraken makes eight tentacle attacks and one mandibles attack. It can substitute two tentacles attacks for one constrict attack if it has a creature {@condition grappled} at the start of its turn, but it never constricts more than once per turn.

action.name: Mangling Mandibles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 5d8 + 7}) slashing damage. This attack scores a critical hit on a target that is {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 35 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 1d10 + 9}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d6}) slashing damage. If two tentacle attacks hit the same target in one turn, the target is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 120}).

action.name: Constrict
entries: The constricted creature takes 29 ({@damage 3d12 + 9}) bludgeoning damage and is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}) and {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Storm Cloud {@recharge 5}
entries: The kraken emits dark, rolling clouds that flash with lightning in a 30-foot cloud as a bonus action. The cloud affects vision as the darkness spell, and any creature that starts its turn inside the cloud takes 22 ({@damage 4d8}) lightning damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. At the beginning of each of the kraken's turns, it can select three creatures. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 3d10}) lightning damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. The kraken's {@sense darkvision} is not impaired by this cloud. The cloud persists for 1 minute, then disperses.

action.name: Vomit Forth the Deeps (1/Day)
entries: The kraken sprays electrified bile from its maw over a 30-foot cone. This shocking slurry causes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) lightning damage and targets must make a successful {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Lightning Strike {@recharge}
entries: The kraken conjures a magical lightning bolt at a point it can see within 500 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 10d8}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Tentacle
entries: The kraken makes a tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Hammer Arm (Uses 2 Actions)
entries: The kraken slams one of its bludgeoning arms down at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@dice 8d6}) bludgeoning and lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The kraken moves up to half its speed.

As our vessel crashed through yet another destructive wave, a number of the men started screaming and pointing at something in the sky. Looking up at it, I- Gods alive… Long, dark tentacles dangled from the sky as something descended from the rolling storm above. Lightning flashed, and the silhouette of a squid-like monster was illuminated by the flaring light. Its tendrils coiled around various members of the crew as an electric roar echoed louder than thunder. Hemmins, Jackson, Cathaway… it ate them. It ate them all.

Louder than thunder and more potent than lightning, the Kraken is a monstrous colossal squid that developed a destructive bond with the Elemental Plane of Air, harnessing the soul of the storm to wreak havoc on unsuspecting ships. Like its rival and nemesis, the White Whale, the Kraken exclusively preys on the flesh of humanoids, preferring the taste of sentient flesh and blood to anything else. On clear, sunny days, the Kraken drifts underneath the waves, submerged, scanning the horizon for evidence of humanoid presence. When lighting crackles through the air and the clouds are thick and dark, the Kraken rises up, hiding in the clouds and pulling sailors, pirates, and even entire ships into the sky to be crushed and devoured.
